guiPack

Class FileHandlerModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • guiPack.FileHandlerModel

  • public class FileHandlerModel
extends java.lang.Object
    A model component to handle files and write/read files for the UserController.
    Author:
    Douglas Wallin

      • getTokens

        private java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTokens(java.lang.String line)
        A helper method that takes a String and returns a list of Strings using commmas as a delimiter.
        Parameters:
        line - String: The string to broken down to tokens
        Returns:
        List The ouput in the format of Strings "tokens" in a list
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • deTokenize

        private java.lang.String deTokenize(java.util.List<java.lang.String> line)
        Reconstructs a list of tokens back to a single string.
        Parameters:
        line - List: The current line as a list of strings(tokens).
        Returns:
        String: A de-tokenized version of the current line. In other words back to a single string

      • loadUser

        public Tuple<User,java.util.List<java.lang.Boolean>> loadUser(java.lang.String name,
                                                              java.lang.String pass)
                                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Tries to load a user based on search parameters of a String(username) and another String(password). If it is able to find an user with matching name it will set the second boolean to true. It it is able to find an user with matching name and password it will also set the first boolean to be true, and create an user based on the information stored in the file
        Parameters:
        name - String: The username of the target user
        pass - String:
        Returns:
        Tuple>: A tuple object containing an user if one was successfully loaded. And also a list of two booleans describing ton what degree the loadUser call succeeded
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Exception

      • writeMidFile

        public void writeMidFile(java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.String category,
                         java.lang.String content)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Method to insert information into an users saved profile.
        Parameters:
        name - String: The username of the user to have information added
        category - String: A key to tell the scanner where to put the information
        content - String: The info to be added
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Exception

      • clearFile

        public void clearFile(java.io.File file)
               throws java.io.IOException
        This method resets the passed file to be empty. Should only be called when the user decides to reset the accounts folder.
        Parameters:
        file - File: The file to be reset
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Exception

      • writeToFile

        private void writeToFile(java.lang.String content,
                         java.io.File file)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        This method writes some String to an empty file. Sister method to appendToFile()
        Parameters:
        content - String: The content to be added to the user's information in the file
        file - File: The file to be written to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Exception

      • appendToFile

        private void appendToFile(java.lang.String content,
                          java.io.File file)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        This method adds a string to a file. The only difference between appendToFile and writeToFile is that appendToFile writes to a non-empty file.
        Parameters:
        content - String: The content to be written to the file
        file - File: The file to be written to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Exception

      • makeAccount

        public User makeAccount(java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.String pass)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Creates an account for an user and records the account information in accounts.txt.
        Parameters:
        name - String: The user's username
        pass - String: The user's password
        Returns:
        User: An instance of the user class to represent the new account (makes the new account the logged in user)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Exception

        private boolean isEmpty()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Checks to see if the accountsFile is empty.
        Returns:
        Boolean: Whether the file is empty or not
        Throws:
